title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations of $10,000,000 for fiscal years 2004 through 2008 to provide child care for certain military dependents under section 658T of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. Child Care Assistance for Military Dependents is added to the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. The Secretary will provide grants to help eligible persons pay for child care services for dependents by eligible providers. A dependent is defined as an individual meeting specific criteria. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a reserve component member serving on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a reserve component member serving on active duty for a military operation under certain conditions. The eligible person must have primary responsibility for the care of the dependents and reside permanently at a location at least 50 miles away. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a reserve component member serving on active duty for a military operation who has primary responsibility for their care and resides permanently at a location at least 50 miles away from military installations with child care facilities. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a reserve component member serving on active duty for a military operation funded by the Department of Defense and available for use by dependents of the member. Military operation includes Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with details about the child care provider. Certain provisions of this subchapter do not apply to the assistance provided under this section. Certain provisions of section 658P do not apply to assistance provided under this section. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS to the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990, specifically changing references to appropriations under different sections.
